author: JELH

text: Even if they did come out and say "we're making a Wii U port," The Wii U wouldn't be able to handle the game regardless. Even if R* did port it on Wii U, there would be no 1080p, a major drop in framrate, and also Nintendo has awful multiplayer severs (I had a Wii, Super Smash Bros Brawl had garbage online play). GTA V can barely handle itself on PS3 and 360 already with the cloud servers on multiplayer, the texture pop ups, and the draw distance would decrease on Wii U.

author: Konata Izumi

text: It's only endless as far as Nintendo continues to put out already outdated hardware.  If they want to be innovative with peripheral devices, they have to show us why they're interesting and get developers to see that and utilize them too.  It's not happening with the Wii U (because the Wii U isn't interesting), and it (largely) didn't happen with the Wii.
author: totlyepic

text: Anything would be a big title for Wii U because it has nothing.
author: totlyepic

text: I feel as if Nintendo never makes the right move when it comes to their consoles. Their handheld systems I always feel are strong with sales and games to support but lately with the Wii and Wii U, it's just not happening.
author: TheGrottoMotto

text: Oh yeah, certainly. Nintendo doesn't seem to keen on the idea but they have to realize eventually while their titles are good it'll only get them so far. Supposedly the Wii U is attempting to make indie games easier to add for the system which is good and almost makes me think an XBLIG thing would be good if better moderated. GTAV would also be great to prove as fact the system can handle the same as the other systems(something customers and developers are yet convinced of)

author: Lucio Fernandes

text: Really digging this tune, and am so excited for this game. I haven't been to a midnight release of a game since Mass Effect 3, and thinking this will be the next one. I'll be picking up on 360 and can't wait to hear the soundtrack for GTA V. They always have some great radio stations to listen to.
author: VideoGameCollector17

text: Errr yeah, Metal Gear Rising is more like it. And I agree, they'll no doubt face the same problem in the next couple years unfortunately. Still, getting GTA V which is arguably this year's biggest game would be a great move on Nintendo's part and send a message that they're willing to cater to an expanded audience.
author: SupraDarky

text: Nintendo has a ridiculous amount of money sitting in their bank. They need to start using it more, in a smart way. Getting 3rd party support is essential. Sure, exclusives as much as possible, but they should at least try getting the big games coming out on their competitors' consoles. Microsoft did exactly that back then by getting GTA IV, Final Fantasy XIII, Metal Gear Solid 4, etc. and it worked.
author: SupraDarky

text: Its the endless cycle "Wii U has no 3rd party games" and when it finally gets one "Why would i get this game on Wii U when i can get it for my 360"    -_-*
author: Bosspuma

text: This could be a big title for Wii U if released for it. That said, the Wii U's biggest problem would still exist, it lacks the exclusives to draw people in as most will still wind up only getting the game for PS3/360, even if it were announced for PS4, they'd still get it on PS3. PS3 I remember had the same problem for quite awhile, everyone still insisted on getting everything for PS2. We're slowly but surely becoming accustomed to what we have and not needing to go much further.
author: Arc13

text: The Epsilon Program is a fictional religious cult in the GTA games. It was first used as a teaser site for GTA San Andreas, so it makes sense now that it's back in action to tease GTA V (which returns to San Andreas). They released a screensaver today along with a simple but surprisingly relaxing theme. I'm very excited for this game. Nintendo should do﻿ everything in its power to get this game on the Wii U and announce it during E3.
author: SupraDarky
